docs.lead_paragraph: Gloria Paige overcame decades of drug abuse to confront mental illness, find clarity in writing and reconnect with her estranged sons.

headline.main: In the Wake of Addiction, a Life Bright With Purpose
headline.print_headline: Substance Abuse Gives Way to a Life Bright With Clarity and Salvaged Relationships

docs.abstract: Federation of Protestant Welfare Agencies, one of seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, provides Gloria Paige of Queens with money to buy household items and clothes to aid her in her job search.
docs.snippet: Gloria Paige overcame decades of drug abuse to confront mental illness, find clarity in writing and reconnect with her estranged sons.

docs.lead_paragraph: With a deeper-than-ever split between Republicans and Democrats over abortion, activists on both sides of the debate foresee a 2016 presidential campaign in which the nominees tackle the volatile topic more aggressively than in past elections.

headline.main: Activists Predict Abortion Will Be a Hot Issue in Campaigns
headline.print_headline: Activists Predict Abortion Will Be a Hot Issue in Campaigns

docs.snippet: With a deeper-than-ever split between Republicans and Democrats over abortion, activists on both sides of the debate foresee a 2016 presidential campaign in which the nominees tackle the volatile topic more aggressively than in past elections.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of students completing high school has reached historic peaks, yet other measures of academic readiness for college or jobs are much lower.

headline.main: As Graduation Rates Rise, Experts Fear Diplomas Come Up Short
headline.print_headline: As Graduation Rates Rise, a Fear Diplomas Fall Short

docs.abstract: School districts nationwide report number of students earning high school diplomas has climbed to record highs, but measures of academic preparedness for college or jobs are much lower; educators are questioning true worth of high school diploma and whether graduation requirements in many states are giving students really chance at career success.
docs.snippet: The number of students completing high school has reached historic peaks, yet other measures of academic readiness for college or jobs are much lower.

docs.lead_paragraph: At first, the trial and convictions in the death of Farkhunda Malikzada seemed a victory in the long struggle to give Afghan women their due in court. But a deeper look suggests otherwise.

headline.main: Flawed Justice After a Mob Killed an Afghan Woman
headline.print_headline: A Mob Killing and Flawed Justice

docs.abstract: Mob killing in Afghanistan of Farkhunda, 27-year-old woman Islam student who was falsely accused of burning Quran in Muslim shrine, sparked national outrage, but most of accused, some of whom never stood trial, received minor punishments; her murder and legal system's response call into question over decade of Western attempts in Afghanistan to impose rule of law and improve status of women (Series: Women's War).
docs.snippet: At first, the trial and convictions in the death of Farkhunda Malikzada seemed a victory in the long struggle to give Afghan women their due in court. But a deeper look suggests otherwise.

byline.contributor: Ahmad Shakib and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the early weeks of Angelica Pereira's pregnancy, a mosquito bite began bothering her. At first it seemed a small thing. But the next day she awoke with a rash, a headache, a fever and a burning in her eyes. The symptoms disappeared within four days, but she fears the virus has left lasting consequences.

headline.main: Brazil Fears Birth Defects Linked to Mosquito-Borne Virus
headline.print_headline: Brazil Fears Birth Defects Linked to Mosquito-Borne Virus
